revised_title: Efficient Methods for Diagnosing Mistakes in EDSAC Programs
tldr: This article discusses methods developed at the Cambridge University Mathematical Laboratory for quickly diagnosing mistakes in programs for the EDSAC, an automatic high-speed digital computer. The aim is to minimize wasted machine time and to use standard routines in conjunction with faulty programs to check their operation. Two of these routines are examined in detail, while others are briefly described.
